intro: Nepeta nuda var. grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered catmint, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs and lance-shaped leaves that are aromatic when crushed. The plant produces showy, pale blue to lavender flowers in whorls along the stems, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens. Due to its ornamental value and pleasant fragrance, it is often used in landscaping and as a companion plant for other herbs.
